comments: Tests covering query state checkpointing smoke test cases

tests.name: tail
tests.description: tail state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream if not exists state_stream(i int, s string)
subscribe to select i, s from state_stream settings seek_to='earliest', checkpoint_interval=1

tests.name: recover-from
tests.description: recover tail query from a checkpoint

statements.query: create stream if not exists state_stream(i int, s string)
subscribe to select i, s from state_stream settings seek_to='earliest', checkpoint_interval=1

tests.name: recover-from-unsubscribed
tests.description: recover from an unsubscribed query shall fail

tests.name: recover-from-non-exists
tests.description: recover from a non-exists query shall fail

tests.name: global_aggr_without_group_by
tests.description: global aggregation state checkpoint without group by

statements.query: create stream if not exists state_stream(i int, s string)
subscribe to select count(), sum(i), avg(i), min(i), max(i), min(s), max(s) from state_stream emit periodic 1s settings checkpoint_interval=1

tests.name: recover_global_aggr_without_group_by
tests.description: recover global aggregation state checkpoint without group by

statements.query: create stream if not exists state_stream(i int, s string)
subscribe to select count(), sum(i), avg(i), min(i), max(i), min(s), max(s) from state_stream emit periodic 2s settings checkpoint_interval=1

tests.name: global_aggr_with_group_by
tests.description: global aggregation state checkpoint with group by

statements.query: create stream if not exists state_stream(i int, s string)
subscribe to select count(), sum(i), avg(i), min(i), max(i), min(s), max(s) from state_stream group by s emit periodic 1s settings checkpoint_interval=1

tests.name: recover_global_aggr_with_group_by
tests.description: recover global aggregation state checkpoint with group by

statements.query: create stream if not exists state_stream(i int, s string)
subscribe to select count(), sum(i), avg(i), min(i), max(i), min(s), max(s) from state_stream group by s emit periodic 1s settings checkpoint_interval=1

tests.name: tumble_window_aggr
tests.description: tumble window aggregation state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream if not exists state_stream(i int, s string)
subscribe to select count(), sum(i), avg(i), min(i), max(i), min(s), max(s) from tumble(state_stream, 2s) group by window_start settings checkpoint_interval=1

tests.name: recover_tumble_window_aggr
tests.description: recover tumble window aggregation state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream if not exists state_stream(i int, s string)
subscribe to select count(), sum(i), avg(i), min(i), max(i), min(s), max(s) from tumble(state_stream, 2s) group by window_start settings checkpoint_interval=1
insert into state_stream(i, s, _tp_time) values (6, 's4', '2022-01-01 00:00:03'), (7, 'wont appear in result', '2022-01-01 00:00:04')

tests.name: recover_global_aggr_with_fun_count_distinct
tests.description: recover global aggregation with function count_distinct from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select count_distinct(id) from state_stream emit periodic 1s settings checkpoint_interval=1

tests.name: recover_global_aggr_with_fun_count_if
tests.description: recover global aggregation with function count_if from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select count_if(value > 58) from state_stream emit periodic 1s settings checkpoint_interval=1

tests.name: recover_global_aggr_with_fun_distinct
tests.description: recover global aggregation with function distinct from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select distinct(id) from state_stream emit periodic 1s settings checkpoint_interval=1

tests.name: recover_global_aggr_with_fun_unique
tests.description: recover global aggregation with function unique from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select unique(id) from state_stream emit periodic 1s settings checkpoint_interval=1

tests.name: recover_global_aggr_with_fun_unique_exact
tests.description: recover global aggregation with function unique_exact from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select unique_exact(id) from state_stream emit periodic 1s settings checkpoint_interval=1

tests.name: recover_global_aggr_with_fun_unique_exact_if
tests.description: recover global aggregation with function unique_exact_if from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select unique_exact_if(id, value > 57.0) from state_stream emit periodic 1s settings checkpoint_interval=1

tests.name: recover_global_aggr_with_fun_median
tests.description: recover global aggregation with function median from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select median(value) from state_stream emit periodic 1s settings checkpoint_interval=1

tests.name: recover_global_aggr_with_fun_quantile
tests.description: recover global aggregation with function quantile from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select quantile(value, 0.5) from state_stream emit periodic 1s settings checkpoint_interval=1

tests.name: recover_global_aggr_with_fun_P90
tests.description: recover global aggregation with function P90 from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select quantile(value,  0.9) from state_stream emit periodic 1s settings checkpoint_interval=1

tests.name: recover_global_aggr_with_fun_P95
tests.description: recover global aggregation with function P95 from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select quantile(value,  0.95) from state_stream emit periodic 1s settings checkpoint_interval=1

tests.name: recover_global_aggr_with_top_k
tests.description: recover global aggregation with function top_k from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select top_k(id, 2) from state_stream emit periodic 1s settings checkpoint_interval=1

tests.name: recover_global_aggr_with_min_k
tests.description: recover global aggregation with function min_k from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream (id string, location string, value int, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select min_k(value, 2, id) from state_stream emit periodic 1s settings checkpoint_interval=1

tests.name: recover_global_aggr_with_max_k
tests.description: recover global aggregation with function max_k from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream (id string, location string, value int, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select max_k(value, 2, id) from state_stream emit periodic 1s settings checkpoint_interval=1

tests.name: recover_global_aggr_with_group_array
tests.description: recover global aggregation with function group_array from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select group_array(id) from state_stream emit periodic 1s settings checkpoint_interval=1
insert into state_stream(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev1', 'ca', 57.3, '2020-02-02 20:00:00'), ('dev2', 'ca', 58.3, '2020-02-02 20:00:03')
insert into state_stream(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev4', 'ca', 80, '2020-02-02 20:00:05'), ('dev8', 'ca', 55, '2020-02-02 20:00:07')

tests.name: global_aggr_with_fun_moving_sum
tests.description: global aggregation with function moving_sum state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream (id string, location string, value int, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select moving_sum(value) from state_stream emit periodic 1s settings checkpoint_interval=1
insert into state_stream(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev4', 'ca', 80, '2020-02-02 20:00:05'), ('dev8', 'ca', 55, '2020-02-02 20:00:07')

tests.name: recover_func_lag
tests.description: recover function lag from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream (id string, location string, value int, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select value, lag(value) as prev_1, lag(value, 3, 0) as prev_3_0 from state_stream settings checkpoint_interval=1
insert into state_stream(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev1', 'ca', 1, '2020-02-02 20:00:00')
insert into state_stream(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev1', 'ca', 2, '2020-02-02 20:00:01')
insert into state_stream(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev2', 'ca', 3, '2020-02-02 20:00:03')
insert into state_stream(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev2', 'ca', 4, '2020-02-02 20:00:04') ('dev3', 'ca', 5, '2020-02-02 20:00:05') ('dev4', 'ca', 6, '2020-02-02 20:00:06')

tests.name: recover_func_neighbor
tests.description: recover function neighbor from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream (id string, location string, value int, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select value, neighbor(value, -1) as prev_1, neighbor(value, -3, 0) from state_stream settings checkpoint_interval=1
insert into state_stream(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev1', 'ca', 1, '2020-02-02 20:00:00')
insert into state_stream(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev1', 'ca', 2, '2020-02-02 20:00:01')
insert into state_stream(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev2', 'ca', 3, '2020-02-02 20:00:03')
insert into state_stream(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev2', 'ca', 4, '2020-02-02 20:00:04') ('dev3', 'ca', 5, '2020-02-02 20:00:05') ('dev4', 'ca', 6, '2020-02-02 20:00:06')

tests.name: recover_func_dedup
tests.description: recover function dedup from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream if not exists state_stream(i int, s string)
subscribe to select i, s from dedup(state_stream, s) settings checkpoint_interval=1
